intro: Corymborkis densiflora, commonly known as the dense-flowered corymborkis, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its dense clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered with fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Corymborkis densiflora is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and understorey environments.
